reviews.text: Was totally a rememberable experience for me & my hubby, Rudy!!!

I've always wanted to go to City Island, a far-flung neighborhood of the Bronx that's a schlep from most parts of the rest of the city, especially if you rely on public transport. But we had the opportunity to drive there, and decided to go to CIYC for dinner. The staff were wonderful and welcoming from the moment we called to make a reservation. One wasn't needed, it turned out, but in booking it, we did secure a table with beautiful views of Pelham Bay, and the city on the horizon. The food was wonderful, and we're happy we ordered the new Mac & Cheese recipe the chef tried. We even learned a little about the local life from our server who was a proud "clam digger". The restaurant is open to the public, attire is casual, and parking is available.
Excellent food, great service, and a beautiful view. What a wonderful find that‚Äôs so close and yet feels so far from the city.
This is where you want to be. It's more like family!

I don't think "unfriendly" would be accurate, but certainly inhospitable to transients. Called to ask about dinghy dock usage: "no, we don't really do that". Asked about transient mooring: "Well, thunderstorms are forecast, and we have sailing school going on." Seriously????
Un lugar de esparcimiento , muy acogedor , una maravillosa vista panor√°mica .
Sailing school. Transient moorings available. Restaurant Friday, Saturday, Sunday. Clean restrooms and showers.

CIYC is a welcoming, self-functioning marina for boaters.
The members are friendly, helpful and have great camaraderie. The view of Eastchester Bay from the porch is exceptional. The sponsor races, teach ASA approved‚Ä¶

City Island Yacht Club is our favorite place to spend time from May to October (during the sailing season). We moved our boat here a few years ago and can't imagine sailing out of any other club. The convenience factor, incredible community‚Ä¶
Traditional venue.  Amazing chef.   Unique adventure in a cradle of NYC sailing.  Not to be missed
Food has no flavor. Menu needs variety and the place needs to brought into the 20th century

Very nice yacht club, the location is ideally suited for mooring off vessels, with a hauling area, floating style docks, launch service to ferry vessel owners to and from their moored off vessels, restaurant and bar facilities and also young masters training school for young kids to acquire the skill and art of sailing.

We came to City Island for the first time today when my girlfriends mother was visiting NY. It‚Äôs supposedly known for great seafood. We found city Island Yacht Club on google and the view looked great so we tried it out.  Our food took over‚Ä¶

I am a social CIYC  member, and go there frequently to Race on Eagle with Ernie Bivona, who used to be a club commodore few years back.  Club is very well managed and attentive to club members needs, most of the members are "old boys" with years of experience sailing and owning the boats. Dinners after regatas are great, with members commenting on the race and having fun.. Facilities are aged but well maintained and adequate for racers and day racers. Great atmosphere and very friendly club. Great mooring field with easy and protected access. Lots of restaurants on the Island if you need more dining options ( I don't) ,Only complain I haver is commuting from NJ. But I love it.
The restaurant is run by hired outside chefs, this year we have excellent one. Any issues with food are addressed right away and corrected. don't blame CIYC for chef having a bad day, if it repeats he will get replaced.
It was very nice and scenic. People were and the staff were very nice and professional. Relatively easy to get to. Get there early parking lot fills up. Restaurant and bar on the premises.
La .musica no serbia
Loved my visit...

1st time  At City Island yacht club food was  Excellent  Farah the chef had a great personality made sure our dinner was perfect and Debbie the bartender made us feel at home  Very courteous and professional We'll be back!

Went to this establishment for a dinner with a bunch of friends and the food and the ambiance were absolutely wonderful.
The appetizers and the main dish dishes were excellently prepared and most‚Ä¶
Very nice for visiting sailors. Food was very good and a great view of the city in the distance. Easy location just NW of the throggsneck. Perfect for timing a hells gate transit.

Beautiful building, amazing people, great views of the ocean, I came here for a family event and could not say enough good things about this yacht club.  Really great place that will hold memories in my heart.

This is a great place for people who love to sail or want to give it a try. The atmosphere is relaxed and people are friendly and helpful. The club has a beautiful view of Manhattan from the covered porch. Different levels of membership, the sailing school and many organized races and cruises accommodate beginners and experts alike.
Best views in the Bronx! Takes your mind off Covid and all your troubles! Breath of freah air!
The place is amazing! Beautiful views and delicious food.
Best place around the year
Excelent view üòâ‚Ä¶
Beautiful yacht club. Great staff and services
Great place if your looking to become a boat member
Great to have a cousin who is a member..
Had a well time ,good atmosfere..
Men's bathroom is really bad.
amazing sunset

City Island YC is a great place with fun members, lots of boats available to sail on, become a crew member and great food with a new Chef cooking special dishes. Or have your special family or business event there and have an incredible view of NYC at sunset looking to the West ! I have enjoyed this CIYC now for 32 + years !
The skyline is breathtaking & the members are very kind.
It may be private(members only), but it sure provides an ideal scenery for any occasion.
Who can complain about a club that is just minutes from the center of Manhattan.
Peaceful and beautiful
Great yacht club
Went for a sunset cruise, everything went sailing...
Most. Pleasent place in the Bronx
Phenomenal, anyone can experience sailboat racing at this club. All age groups and levels of experience. ASA school on the premises as well. #nycsailing
Joined a sailing meetup where we learned to rig and sail for FREE! Every Monday night, people are amazing, the instructors are so friendly & helpful. Can't wait to go back!
Great food, pleasant staff, excellent launch service, and a great view.
Laid back scene with beautiful views of the water and the NYC skyline.
Friendly. Nice place to visit. Great sailing.
Beatiful view and delicious food!
Wonderful place to sail and meet congenial people.
Delish setting and fine wine
Best yacht club on City Island.
Es un lugar muy agradable
Fun spot.
It is a beautiful place
